The three men have been linked to the Trump administration in another way: They filed a lawsuit against Fusion GPS, the Washington-based research and intelligence firm that hired a former British intelligence officer to compile what became known as the Steele Dossier, purportedly documenting compromising connections Trump might have to Russia — information that remains largely unverified.
Aven, Fridman and Khan say the document harmed their business reputations by alleging their association with Kremlin efforts to interfere in the 2016 U.S. elections.
Aven, 62, is co-founder of the Alfa Group, which includes Alfa Bank, Russia's largest commercial bank.
Aven's partners at Alfa Group also are on the list — Mikhail Fridman and German Khan.
